headline: River crossings cannot be guaranteed regardless of timing
summary: Mara River crossings are spectacular but unpredictable. Even during peak crossing season (July-October), herds may wait days at the river or cross at unpredictable times. Camps near crossing points improve odds but cannot guarantee sightings. A trip focused solely on crossings may disappoint; crossings should be possible bonus, not the primary goal.

assumptions.text: Crossings depend on herd behavior, water levels, and predator presence; none is predictable.
July-October offers the best odds for crossings in northern Serengeti or Mara.
Camps near known crossing points significantly improve odds.

gains: Peak season: Herds are in the area
Strategic camp placement: Near known crossing points
losses: Waiting at crossing points is time-intensive
Herds may cross early morning or at night
Trip focused on crossings may disappoint

change_conditions: If crossings are essential, stay minimum 4-5 nights near crossing points.
If trip is short, treat crossings as bonus not goal.
If willing to wait, guides can position for best odds with patience.
If dates are flexible, follow real-time migration reports before booking.
